DOCNAME: CASE OF YASİN ATEŞ v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 38 - Examination of the case-{general} (Article 38 - Obligation to furnish all necessary facilities);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Life) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect);No violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment;Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Deprivation of liberty);Violation of Article 13+2 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy) (Article 2 - Right to life;Article 2-1 - Effective investigation);Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , a NORP citizen of NORP origin , was born in DATE . At the time of the events giving rise to the present application , he lived in the town of GPE , located within the administrative jurisdiction of the province of ORG , in south - east GPE .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , particularly concerning events which took place on DATE , are disputed by the parties .

CARDINAL . The facts as presented by the applicant are set out in Section B below ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) . The Government 's submissions concerning the events are summarised in Section C below ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) . The documentary evidence submitted by the parties is summarised in Section D below ( see paragraphs LAW ) .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant 's son , PERSON , lived in ORG where he worked for ORG , a business which sold foodstuffs wholesale to small businesses and security and military establishments in the region .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE PERSON , together with his colleague PERSON , left ORG to go to the town of ORG to sell foodstuffs . They used a small lorry owned by ORG . They were accompanied by PERSON 's father - in - law PERSON , his paternal uncle PERSON and a man called PERSON . At PERSON , PERSON disembarked from the vehicle due to overcrowding and continued his journey in another vehicle .

CARDINAL . The lorry came off LOC at the ORG turn - off and headed towards the town of ORG . At TIME , QUANTITY before the ORG fork , the vehicle slowed to a halt as a result of a police minibus blocking the width of the road . Thereafter , CARDINAL police officers surrounded the van with firearms and proceeded to carry out an identity check of all the occupants . This resulted in PERSON and ORG being ordered out of the lorry and taken by a police minibus to the police checkpoint at the entrance to the ORG district . The other occupants were told to follow in the lorry .

CARDINAL . The CARDINAL men were told to wait at the police checkpoint at Lice without receiving an explanation for their detention . PERSON , who had by then arrived at the police point in the other vehicle , sought an explanation but was stopped by the police . After TIME a grey - coloured ORG saloon car , with the registration number CARDINAL ORG , arrived . CARDINAL plain - clothed police officers with pistols got out . CARDINAL of the police officers was a DATE , of medium height , wearing a grey jumper and holding a walkie - talkie . This police officer proceeded to ask who owned the lorry and what names each of the men were known by in the village from where they came . PERSON replied “ ORG ” and PERSON PERSON replied “ Galevan ” .

CARDINAL . Thereafter the plain - clothes police officers informed the men that they were to be taken back to ORG , to ORG of the Police , as there was a problem concerning some cheques . PERSON and PERSON said to the police that they had simply boarded the lorry as passengers and had nothing to do with any cheques . However , they , together with ORG , were ordered to drive the lorry back to ORG , in front of the ORG . PERSON was placed into the back of the ORG , in between CARDINAL police officers .

CARDINAL . The vehicles stopped outside ORG , located at the entrance to ORG , where the CARDINAL men were told to remain in their respective vehicles . CARDINAL officers then entered the ORG . TIME more police cars arrived with CARDINAL men in each vehicle , who proceeded to talk with the police who had detained the men in LOC . The CARDINAL cars were similar to the ORG .

CARDINAL . At this point PERSON , who was still in the ORG , indicated to PERSON and PERSON that they were in danger by biting his lip . As a result , PERSON became distressed and panicked , saying “ They are going to kill me ” . He was given permission to go to the toilet , which led to all CARDINAL men being placed in the hallway of the ORG .

CARDINAL . After TIME CARDINAL plain - clothes police officers from the CARDINAL cars that had arrived later entered the hall , carrying firearms . They asked “ Which of you are PERSON and PERSON ? ” Both men identified themselves and were ordered to go with the officers to CARDINAL of the cars which had arrived later . A tall man next to the officer with the walkie - talkie ordered them to turn to face the car whereupon they were blindfolded by a heavily - built officer who then pushed them into the back of the car and proceeded to sit next to them .

CARDINAL . NORP The officer with the walkie - talkie sat in the front of the vehicle , and enquired as to whether they knew what offences they had committed to which ORG replied , “ No ” . PERSON said , “ It was the PERSON shoes . ” The police officer then enquired where they were taking the shoes . PERSON replied , “ There were CARDINAL pairs . I was taking them to the mountains ” . The officer then proceeded to punch PERSON , stating , “ Son of a whore , are there still such macho men left in the south - east ? ”

CARDINAL . The car then set off . The officer informed them that they were being taken to the military and added “ Do you know what the military do ... you 'll find out when you get there . ” He then instructed the driver to turn onto LOC . The car eventually stopped outside ORG where they were taken to a cell in which ORG , still blindfolded , was handcuffed to the door . He heard the officer order PERSON to strip .

CARDINAL . Thereafter , ORG heard PERSON 's screams and cries which continued for TIME . PERSON was then ordered to strip , after which he was tortured for TIME : he had his testicles squeezed , was hosed down with cold water and electric shocks were applied to him . He was then interrogated by a “ Commander ” in front of CARDINAL people .

CARDINAL . Gürgün Can , ORG 's cousin and business partner , was also placed in custody . On DATE , ORG was placed in another cell next to an inmate whom he correctly suspected was Can . His blindfold was removed . Thereafter both men were subjected to noise being played on a tape machine at an unbearably high level .

CARDINAL . On DATE of custody GPE was taken for interrogation and again subjected to beatings , during which he continued to deny all accusations . His interrogators then stated , “ You 're very lucky . Have n't you heard ? We have killed PERSON . He kicked the bucket . If they had n't killed him , we 'd have murdered you ” . Thereafter they informed him , “ Your time is up ... You have CARDINAL choices . Either you will go to join PERSON , or we 'll send you to prison and you 'll kill CARDINAL people with the poison we will give you ” . They further added , “ Look , there are teams here . If we surrender you to them , they will kill you like PERSON ” .

CARDINAL . Vehbi was taken to an unknown place . At the entrance his interrogators told him , “ Do n't you know where this is ? Look , there are teams here . If we surrender you to them , they will kill you like PERSON ” . ORG continued to assert his innocence , whereupon his interrogator said , “ I 'm telling you , you only have CARDINAL choices . Either I will surrender you to the teams , or you 'll agree to go to the prison . ” At that point GPE was taken inside and placed in a cell where he was told , “ If your friend had not died , we 'd have killed you now . It appears you are lucky . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE of custody GPE was given a typed statement to sign . TIME he was taken to the Dağkapı health clinic where he was threatened and told not to make any allegations , but the doctor , in any event , did not examine him .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL people were brought before ORG ( hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) ; GPE , PERSON and PERSON Can were among them . The first CARDINAL were released by the Prosecutor whereas Can was released by a judge . PERSON was remanded in custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE , that is DATE after PERSON was detained , the applicant applied to ORG to obtain information concerning the detention of his son . He was informed that his son was not in custody and was referred to ORG where he received the same information .

CARDINAL . The applicant was subsequently informed by the Prosecutor in the town of ORG that PERSON had died in a clash between security forces and the ORG . The applicant had the body of his son exhumed from the ORG cemetery and buried him in his home town of GPE .

CARDINAL . An official ORG stated that the CARDINAL men had been observed at TIME in an ORG lorry , with the registration number CARDINAL ERS CARDINAL , travelling along the ORG road . They had subsequently been detained for suspected participation in terrorist activities , namely the dropping off of supplies to ORG members at the ORG petrol station between the ORG turn - off and FAC , at TIME

CARDINAL . The report stated that PERSON , PERSON and ORG were taken to ORG for interrogation , while PERSON was handed over by the ORG to ORG to help , voluntarily , set up an ambush at the said petrol station . The report further stated that at TIME armed ORG members came to the petrol station and an armed clash ensued in which PERSON was killed .

CARDINAL . The applicant is convinced that PERSON did not die in a clash but was killed in custody under torture . PERSON witnessed PERSON being taken into custody by the police and heard him being tortured .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG received information to the effect that a small lorry with the registration number CARDINAL ERS CARDINAL would be carrying logistical equipment to ORG terrorists and that the terrorists would meet with PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , who would be travelling in the lorry .

CARDINAL . Necessary security measures were taken and at QUANTITY the lorry was stopped at the ORG fork and PERSON was questioned . He stated that he was going to deliver the equipment to the terrorists at a location close to the ORG petrol station near the ORG fork at TIME Thereafter he was arrested in order to be taken to the meeting point . The others were taken to ORG for questioning .

CARDINAL . Upon reaching the meeting point , the necessary security measures were taken and at TIME terrorists arrived to collect the equipment from PERSON . At that point the police asked the terrorists to surrender . However , instead of surrendering , the terrorists opened fire at the security forces and the firing continued for TIME . PERSON made an attempt to escape from the security forces but was shot and killed in the crossfire . CARDINAL terrorists were also shot and killed but the others managed to escape .

CARDINAL . A search was carried out at the scene by soldiers from ORG . During the search , CARDINAL PERSON rifles with serial numbers DATE POCARDINAL and DATE SS CARDINAL , CARDINAL cartridges and CARDINAL chargers were found . Various logistical supplies were also found in the lorry which belonged to PERSON and these supplies were handed over to the competent judicial authorities .
CARDINAL . On DATE the office of ORG carried out autopsies on the bodies of the CARDINAL deceased persons .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant went to the ORG 's office in ORG where he was shown the photographs of his son . In these photographs , the body of the applicant 's son was seen lying next to the bodies of the CARDINAL terrorists . The applicant formally identified his son .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , GPE Can and PERSON were questioned by ORG , who on DATE filed an indictment with that court in which the CARDINAL men were accused of the offence of membership of a terrorist organisation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the CARDINAL men for a lack of sufficient evidence .
CARDINAL . The following information appears from the documents submitted by the parties .
CARDINAL . According to the custody ledgers , PERSON was arrested at TIME , and Gürgün Can at TIME , on DATE .

CARDINAL . A handwritten incident report was drawn up and signed by CARDINAL special police team members and CARDINAL gendarmes at TIME on DATE . There is no information in the document to establish the identities of these officers . According to the report , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and ORG were arrested on DATE during an investigation into the actions of the ORG . PERSON reportedly told the arresting officers that he was planning to meet with members of the ORG at TIME at the ORG petrol station and deliver to them the supplies which he had in the back of his lorry ( registration number CARDINAL ERS CARDINAL ) . PERSON was also reported to have told the arresting officers that he was willing to accompany them to the petrol station where they could set up an ambush in order to apprehend the ORG members . The other CARDINAL arrested persons were then transferred to ORG for questioning . The police and gendarme officers , together with PERSON , went to the petrol station where they took up their positions – PERSON at the place where , according to his agreement with the ORG members , he was supposed to wait , and the police hiding in the vicinity .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL ORG members arrived at the petrol station at TIME When asked by the police officers to surrender , the ORG members opened fire and an armed clash ensued . At that point police officers made an attempt to approach PERSON in order to take him away from the scene . However , he started running towards the ORG members and was shot in the crossfire . The clash continued for TIME . Bodies of CARDINAL of the terrorists and their weapons were found at the scene after the clash had ended . The body of PERSON , who had been shot a number of times , was also lying next to those of the CARDINAL ORG members .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr ORG , ORG district , in whose jurisdiction the killings had taken place , visited ORG in ORG where the CARDINAL bodies had been taken . He was accompanied by PERSON . The Prosecutor and the doctor examined the bodies and drew up a report in which they recorded their findings . Each of the QUANTITY bodies was given a number because their identities were not known . ( The body of PERSON was number CARDINAL . ) The bodies were also photographed .

CARDINAL . Rigor mortis had set in in bodies number CARDINAL and CARDINAL but post mortem hypostasis was not observed . As regards body number CARDINAL , neither rigor mortis nor post mortem hypostasis was observed .

CARDINAL . Examination of body number one revealed that the right frontal region and the parietal region of the brain were completely destroyed , whereas the occipital region was partly destroyed . There was also an injury below the right knee , caused by a rocket missile . The body bore no marks of blows .

CARDINAL . In the course of the examination of body number CARDINAL , CARDINAL bullet entry wounds on the chest , a number of bullet entry wounds in the throat and CARDINAL bullet entry wound on the left foot , as well as the corresponding exit wounds were observed . The body bore MONEY of blows . The report further states that this person was wearing “ terrorist clothing ” .

CARDINAL . Finally , the examination of body number CARDINAL revealed a bullet entry wound in the occipital region of the brain and a corresponding exit wound on the chin ; a bullet entry wound QUANTITY below the left collar bone and a corresponding exit wound below the collar bone ; an injury on the right shoulder , measuring QUANTITY , caused by a firearm , and finally CARDINAL shrapnel injuries below the right collar bone .

CARDINAL . The doctor concluded that the cause of death for bodies number CARDINAL and CARDINAL was the destruction of vital organs , and for body number CARDINAL acute blood loss caused by the firearm injuries . He added that the cause of the deaths was so obvious as to leave no doubt in his mind and therefore there was no reason to carry out classical autopsies .

CARDINAL . The Prosecutor , after having examined the bodies , issued burial licenses and instructed a municipal worker to arrange for the burial of the bodies of the “ CARDINAL terrorists who had no relatives ” .

CARDINAL . Also on DATE ORG sent a letter to the commander of ORG and asked for copies to be forwarded to him of the documents pertaining to the investigation which the commander had carried out into the incident . It further appears from this letter that the gendarme commander had informed the Prosecutor by telephone earlier in DATE about the “ killing of CARDINAL terrorists whose identities are not known ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant went to the office of ORG where he was shown the photographs of the CARDINAL bodies . He identified body number QUANTITY as that of his son PERSON . He also asked for permission to bury his son in his home village .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG had the ORG municipality exhume the body of PERSON . It was handed over to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE Captain PERSON , the commander of ORG , sent a letter to ORG , in reply to the latter 's letter of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . Mr PERSON wrote that at TIME on DATE his station had been informed by telephone that a number of logistical supplies would be delivered to members of the ORG at the ORG petrol station in a lorry . No information had been given about the make or the registration number of the lorry . An operation had been planned by the security forces in the area . At TIME a number of ORG members had arrived at the ORG petrol station in an ORG lorry , with the registration number CARDINAL ERS CARDINAL . The terrorists , when asked to stop by members of the security forces , had responded by opening fire . A short armed clash had ensued and , during the search which had been carried out after the clash , the bodies of CARDINAL terrorists had been found . CARDINAL PERSON rifles and ammunition belonging to the terrorists had also been retrieved at the scene . The supplies in the lorry had later been destroyed by the soldiers .

CARDINAL . Captain PERSON annexed to his letter , inter alia , an on - site incident report and a number of documents which had apparently been found in the lorry . The Government did not make these documents available to either the ORG or the ORG . Captain PERSON further forwarded to the Prosecutor the PERSON rifles and the ammunition retrieved at the site of the armed clash .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG drew up records of confiscation in which the items sent to his office by Captain PERSON were listed . These items included order forms , consignment ledgers and bills belonging to ORG ( item no . CARDINAL ) , the ORG lorry with the registration number CARDINAL ERS CARDINAL ( item no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , and the rifles and ammunition found at the site of the operation ( item no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE a statement was taken from PERSON by ORG at ORG . Mr PERSON denied being a member of the ORG but added that PERSON had had connections with them . He also stated that on DATE PERSON had been giving him a lift in his lorry to the town of GPE when the vehicle had been stopped by members of the security forces near the town of ORG . He , PERSON , ORG and PERSON had been arrested on the spot .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor at ORG filed an indictment with that court , accusing PERSON , PERSON , ORG , PERSON and PERSON of membership of a terrorist organisation , namely the ORG . In this indictment , PERSON was referred to as the “ terrorist who was arrested on DATE together with PERSON Can by members of the security forces , and who was later killed at the ORG petrol station while trying to run away from the security forces during the armed clash between the terrorists and the security forces ” . PERSON , PERSON and PERSON were accused of attempting to take CARDINAL pairs of GPE shoes to terrorists on DATE in a lorry with the registration number CARDINAL ERS CARDINAL , before being arrested by members of the security forces . The indictment also made reference to a number of statements taken from ORG , PERSON and PERSON . With the exception of the statement taken from PERSON , these statements have not been made available to the ORG bodies .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided that he lacked jurisdiction to prosecute “ the CARDINAL terrorists killed in the operation on DATE ” , and sent the file to the ORG 's office at ORG . According to this decision , a number of terrorists had arrived at the ORG petrol station at TIME in an ORG lorry , with the registration number CARDINAL ERS CARDINAL , and CARDINAL of the terrorists had been killed . The body of CARDINAL of the deceased had subsequently been identified as that of PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor at ORG instructed ORG , the ORG gendarme headquarters , the ORG police headquarters and , finally , the GPE gendarme headquarters to search for the perpetrators of the incident “ during which CARDINAL of the terrorists were killed in the armed clash between the terrorists and the security forces ” . The Prosecutor asked to be kept informed DATE of any possible developments in the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the commander of the PERSON gendarme station , near which the incident had taken place , sent a report to ORG . According to this report , a group of terrorists had approached the lorry to take delivery of logistical supplies . When asked by members of the security forces to surrender , the terrorists had opened fire . After the incident CARDINAL of the terrorists had been found dead . The report finally stated that it had not yet been possible to establish the identities of the “ perpetrators of the incident ” . This report was forwarded to the ORG 's office at ORG on DATE by the commander of ORG . In his covering letter , the commander referred to a letter apparently sent to him by the Prosecutor on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held that there was insufficient evidence to conclude that the CARDINAL defendants had aided and abetted a terrorist organisation , and it ordered their acquittal . The court noted that the defendants had confessed , in statements taken from them by the police while they were in custody , to having committed the offence in question . The court noted that the defendants had later denied the contents of their earlier statements . Copies of the statements taken from the defendants during the criminal proceedings have not been made available to the ORG bodies . ORG further ordered the return of the confiscated ORG lorry ( registration number CARDINAL ERS CARDINAL ) to its owner because it had not been established that the lorry had been used in the commission of an offence . The decision became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the judge at ORG asked the Prosecutor at ORG to forward to him a copy of the report of the examination carried out on the body of PERSON ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL above ) . The judge asked for this report to be sent to him “ before the forthcoming hearing on DATE ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor at ORG sent the requested report to the ORG judge .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor at ORG repeated the above mentioned instructions to ORG , the ORG gendarme headquarters , the ORG police headquarters and finally the GPE gendarme headquarters ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

DATE . On DATE he also sent a letter to ORG saying that neither the ownership of the ORG lorry nor the manner in which the terrorists had acquired and used it had yet been established . He further asked ORG to carry out a ballistics examination of the rifles and the bullets , numbered as item no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor at ORG asked ORG to forward to his office the confiscated items registered as nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG branch of ORG sent a letter to ORG at ORG informing him of their intention to bring a civil action against those responsible for the killing of PERSON to claim compensation . The Prosecutor was asked to send to ORG the documents pertaining to the investigation into the killing of PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor at ORG forwarded to the Pensions ' Directorate the documents requested , and informed the latter that the perpetrators had not yet been arrested . The Prosecutor further stated that logistical supplies had been taken to the petrol station by terrorists who had refused to surrender to the security forces .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor at ORG drew ORG attention to the fact that the owner of the ORG lorry had still not been established ( see paragraph DATE above ) . He also repeated his request of DATE and urged ORG to forward to his office the items registered as nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . He finally repeated his instructions of DATE to carry out ballistics examinations on the rifle and the ammunition .

CARDINAL . Also on DATE the Prosecutor at ORG repeated his instructions to ORG , the ORG gendarme headquarters , the ORG police headquarters and finally the GPE gendarme headquarters ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . The Prosecutor further instructed the investigating authorities to establish the identities of the CARDINAL dead terrorists and “ to apprehend them ” .

CARDINAL . The applicant submitted to the ORG copies of statements taken from the applicant and also from PERSON by the applicant 's NORP lawyer . The statement taken from PERSON formed the basis of the applicant 's submissions summarised in Section B above ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) .
